word: The new post office and some of the largest stores in the town had been leveled to the ground--totally destroyed. Other buildings were badly wrecked. And when we saw the fallen walls of the Pacific Press, we were sad at heart; but we could not help rejoicing over the fact that no lives were lost.--Ms 45, 1906, pp. 1, 2. ("A Visit to Mountain View, California," May 6, 1906.)
